claim: Fluid uptake as measured by fluorescent 10kDa Dextran increased upon decreased membrane tension as a result of deadhering CHO cells during trypsinization.
Swip1 bound to actin via Swip1 EF1 domain as shown by GFP-pulldown assay in MDA-MB-231 cells.
Knocking down αvβ5 integrin expression abolished clathrin plaque assembly in HeLa cells
The density of free barbed ends increased as a function of growth stress
Overexpressed CRIB domain of N-WASP localized to Cdc42-containing spots on the plasma membrane in FRaTB cells
Coronin and cofilin-1 intensity peaked at about 4-5 seconds after ABP1-GFP maximal intensity at endocytic patches in budding yeast.
Endogenous Swip1 localized to Rab21+ and B1-integrin-containing early endosomes.

A computational assessment of theoretical conformational changes upon binding of cofilin monomers to an actin filament suggest a minimum of 3 cofilactin interfaces, or two adjacent bound cofilin monomers, induces severing of an actin filament.
Endothelial cells grown on stiffer cells had more actin stress fibers and were themselves stiffer than cells grown on more compliant substrates.
siRNA-A1 silenced Hip1R showed Arp3 and F-actin 'tails' in HeLa cells.
Mechano-sensing clathrin plaques formed independent of actin contractility
Cofilin peaked in concentration about 10 seconds after endocytic scission in mouse 3T3 fibroblasts.
About 30 DNM2 molecules were required for forming the encytosis in SK-MEL-2 cells.

Platinum-replica electron micrographs of unroofed B16F1 mouse melanoma cells showed actin networks in collar-like arrangements around clathrin coat necks and at small lateral patches at the periphery of clathrin coats
Total bending energy of actin filaments increased as a function of membrane tension in endocytic simulations
Treatment of H9 cells with CK-666 resulted in a~50% decrease in the formation of apical membrane initiation sites (AMIS) en route to lumen formation
Endocytic protein ABP1-GFP lifetime increased by 2-3x in budding yeast cells with cofilin mutants
Endocytic adaptor protein End4p-mGFP accumulated more slowly and to a greater number of molecules in fission yeast cells with mutant cofilin allele
The surface area overlap of actin over clathrin increased from ~5% to ~10% coverage from flat to curved pits in four cell types by platinum-replica electron microscopy
Knockdown of either αv or β5 integrins in HeLa cells using specific siRNAs resulted in a complete loss of large and static CCSs
Intensity over time traces of hiPSCs endogenously expressing AP2-RFP and Dynamin2-GFP peaked sequentially
Purified swip1 bound human platelet actin with an affinity of 1.9 ± 0.8 uM
MiTAB, a inhibitor of DNM2 PH domain, led to increased DNM2 recruitment in SK-MEL-2 cells
siRNA silenced Swip1 reduced GFP-Rab21+ (CG-associated) endosome trafficking in MDA-MB-231 cells.
Knockout of __Dictyostelium__ WASP (__wasA-__) led to bipolar localization of WAVE rather than WT localization of WAVE to the leading edge.
Membrane dye (DiI dye) or Dextran uptake for 1 or 5 minutes in HeLa cells colocalize with endogenous GRAF1 staining.
Immunofluorescence of folate-binding protein showed fluorescence in the periphery of KB cells
Switching media from isotonic to hypotonic (75m0sm) media for 2-20 minutes increased the membrane tension from 33.0 ± 7.4 pN to 48.0 ± 17.1 pN, as measured by AFM.
TIRF revealed that Cortactin, Hip1R, and Clathrin were simultaneously recruited to endocytic sites in 3T3 cell.
Decreased clathrin coat dynamics were measured under increased membrane tension using micropipette aspiration
Pyrene-actin binding assays between human myo1e and actin plateaued at a dissociation rate of 440 ± 9 s-1 for ATP concentrations > 2 µM
Cofilin seems to have different effects on actin filaments, such as severing and nucleation, based on its concentration.
The rate constant of cofilin binding to actin filaments was measured to be k+ = 0.013 μM−1s−1
Overexpression of GFP-GRAF1 in HeLa cells showed long (1-5um) tubules that turn over completely within 10 minutes based on fluorescence microscopy
Depleting actin polymerization with latrunculin A led to increased STxB-induced tubular membrane invaginations in HeLa cells
WAVE2 and IRSp53 both localized at ruffles and cell-cell junctions in A431 cells.
Depletion of β1 or β3 integrins by siRNA in HeLa cells showed no difference in the percentage of dynamic or static CCSs as compared to siCTRL cells.
More actin filaments accumulated at sites of simulated endocytosis as a function of membrane tension
After washout of ATP-reducing agents, lifeact-GFP increased photobleaching recovery and preceded scission of the membrane tubule a few minutes later
Endogenous Swip1 associated with Rab21 in Rab21-containing early endosomes in MDA-MB-231 cells as shown by proximity ligation assay (PLA).
Endocytic track lengths of SKMEL-2 cells endogenously expressing Clathrin-RFP and Dynamin-GFP were distributed with peak value around 20-30 seconds
Applying force to clathrin lattices on carbon-coated films caused a larger change in height when clathrin light chain was also present
Endocytic adaptor protein Sla1-GFP accumulated more slowly to sites of endocytosis in a cof1-22 mutant in budding yeast
CortF, withtriple-mutant in tyrosine residues, increased fillopodia retraction frequency
GRAF1-depletion by siRNA knockdown in HeLa cells has no effect on transferrin uptake
Depleting Cdc42 with siRNA led to the buildup of GRAF1-GFP in tubular structures
Simulated fission yeast endocytic actin networks produced ~3000 pN of force, while simulated budding yeast endocytic actin networks produced ~1000 pN of force
At fission yeast endocytic sites, scission protein (spHob1) first detected ~2 seconds before initiation of membrane invagination

ABI2 formed a complex with GRAF1 based on immunoprecipitation of HeLa cell lysates, in a manner dependent on GRAF1 phosphorylation and treatment with mitochondrial damaging agent oligomycin-A and antimycin-A
Fluorescently labeled cortactin assembled coincident with Arp3 and Abp1 in NIH3T3 cells
Resistance to internalization (spring constant) was proportional to membrane tension in continuum membrane mechanics endocytosis simulations
Cryo-electron tomograms of flat clathrin lattices in HeLa cells showed a wide variety of angles for clathrin vertices (120.0 ± 13.3 degrees)
Swiprosin-1 inhibited cofilin-mediated actin depolymerization in vitro.
IRSp53 coimmunoprecipitated with WAVE in NIH3T3 cell lysates.
Cryo-EM analysis of actin filaments showed that filaments bound to ADP-Pi were stiffer than filaments bound to ADP
Efficient lamellipodia actin filament severing requires a cofilin cluster longer than one-half of a helix
GRAF1-depleted HeLa cells (via siRNA treatment) demonstrate ~50% reduction in fluid phase uptake as compared to control cells, shown by FITC-dextran uptake.
Swip1 preferentially bound WT-Rab21 and constitutively active Rab21 over the closely related Rab5 GTPase.
Cortactin mutants lacking phosphorylatable Tyrosine site could not rescue the Knockdown of endogenous cortactin in Hela Cell
Incubation of STxB with Arp2-depleted cells for 5 min at 37C led to the appearance of STxB-containing tubular structures in HeLa cells
Focal adhesion area decreased in A549 cells grown on softer PDMS substrates
NWASP was found around clusters of clathrin heavy chain by TIRF microscopy + super resolution microscopy
Membrane tether pulling on one part of a HeLa cell did not affect membrane tether force on another part of the cell
Knockdown of DNM2 via siRNA showed a reduction of 488-Choleratoxin internalization in differentiated neuronal CAD cells
Membrane mechanics simulations showed that 15 pN of force orthogonal to the plasma membrane base was sufficient to reshape a U shaped pit into a pinched shape
The curvature of the clathrin coat increased as a function of angle to the plasma membrane in SK-MEL2 cells fixed in plastic
Swip1 colocalized with actin at lamellipodia of CHO-K1 cells transfected with GFP-Swip1.
Measurements by super resolution microscopy showed a ~20 nm radial distance between Las17 (WASP) and MYO1 in budding yeast
Overexpressed NWASP-GFP colocalized with fluorescent dextran spots in FRaTb cells

Internalisation of Transferrin (Tf), a marker of clathrin mediated endocytosis, was reduced 10 minutes, but not 1 hour after incubation when REF52 fribroblast cells were cultured on "soft" hydrogels, as opposed to "intermediate" or "stiff" hydrogels.
Higher rates of purified actin polymerization are seen with purified WAVE2 in the presence of purified IRSp53 as compared to WAVE2 alone in vitro.
B3 integrin lifetime increased by ~50% in the absense of B1 integrin and ICAP-1
hiPSCs at the colony edges showed large, paxillin-positive focal adhesions with thick actin stress fibers parallel to the colony edge.
Fluid uptake as measured by fluorescent 10kDa Dextran increased upon relaxation after mechanically induced stretch by vacuum-based equi-bi-axial stretching device in CHO cells.
Using the TNT T7-coupled reticulocyte lysate systems kit, translated WT-IRSp53 incubated with GST was pulled down with N-WASP, whereas IRSp53(DELTA)SH3 did not pull down N-WASP.
More actin accumulated at sites of clathrin-mediated endocytosis in SK-MEL-2 cells treated with hypo-osmotic shock to elevate membrane tension
Knocking down β5-integrin resulted in loss of flat clathrin lattice expansion upon EGF treatment in HSC3-EGFR-GFP cells
Cells injected with anti-cortactin antibodies decreased the degree of transferrin internalization into clone 9 cells
Without clathrin-mediated endocytosis, flat-clathrin lattices and reticular adhesions could not form.
Increased membrane tension, achieved by compression between a polymer cushion, resulted in increased clathrin coat lifetimes.
hPSCs were found to exert strong inward-directed mechanical forces on the ECM at specific locations coinciding with VSFs at the colony edge.
Branched actin filament barbed ends were densely oriented towards the clathrin coated vesicle in B16F1 Cells
As bending energy decreased in simulated endocytic actin filaments, the pit internalization increased proportionally
eGFP-60mer and 120mer nanocages expressed in Arabodopsis with CAAX membrane binding showed a linear relationship between fluorescence intensity and molecule number
The diameter of GRAF1-positive tubules by electron microscopy found in HeLa cells was ~40nm.
siRNA silenced Swip1 showed reduced internalization of B1-integrin in MDA-MB-231 cells.
At zero seconds, 7000 actin proteins associated with endocytic invagination
N-WASP failed to recruit to forming CG endocytic sites.
Clathrin-coated plaques formed on stiff substrates (<31 kPa) more than on softer substrates
WAVE2-ABI1 complex formation via immunoprecipitation was decreased in HeLa cells with GRAF1 knocked down by siRNA
Cells grown on stiffer substrates had more stalled clathrin-coated pits
Actin marker Abp1-mRFP accumulated more slowly and disassembly was delayed at sites of endocytosis in a cof1-22 mutant in budding yeast
Flat clathrin sheet showed more non-hexagonal structures on lower-tension membranes in a computational model.
The percentage clathrin-coated structures with visible actin overlap decreased from ~50% to ~20% from flat to curved pits in four cell types by platinum-replica electron microscopy
In Clathrin lattice formation, Constant Area model is more credible.
siRNA silenced IRSp53 significantly reduced internalized 10kDa TMR Dextran, while siRNA silenced Swip1 did not in MDA-MB-231 cells.
2 mins after addition, ~70% of a fluorescent monoclonal folate receptor-binding antibody was localized to internal spots nonoverlapping with spots marked by fluorescent transferrin
Integrin αVβ5 correlated with flat clathrin lattices in human keratinocytes
The per-filament capping rate of __in vitro__ loaded actin filament networks decreased exponentially as a function of applied force
In loaded in vitro networks, VCA preferentially bound the free barbed ends of actin filaments rather than soluble actin monomers
Of 10 genes investigated, the top 10 candidate off-target sites were not mutated based on sanger sequencing after Cas9 RNP electroporation
Blocking integrin β1 led to reversal of the inhibitory effect of fibronectin on flat formations lattice formation.
87 ± 1.6% of all dynamin containing endocytic events displayed RFP beta actin recruitment
Pulldown assay of NIH3T3 lysates demonstrated a physical linkage between WAVE and Rac by IRSp53.
Lumenoids formed over 3 days in hESCs
Knockdown of Dyn2 decreased the length of filopodia in H1299 cells
Simulated endocytosis decreased as a function of membrane tension
GFP-cdc42L61 (dominant-active) -expressing HeLa cells demonstrate co-localization with Myc-GRAF1 as shown by confocal microscopy images.
Plasma membrane tension and stiffness increased in hepatic stellate cells as a function of substrate stiffness
OVCAR3 and HT1080 cells showed minimal folate receptor expression by immunofluorescence
FCHSD2 localization at sites of endocytosis formed a partial ring around the base of the endocytic site by STED microscopy
Cortactin Knockdown by siRNA decreased the degree of transferrin endocytosis in MDA-MB-231 cells
Fibronectin inhibited the formation of flat clathrin lattices and associated reticular adhesions
U2O cells plated on Col IV and LN111 produced fibronectin which assembled into elongated fibrils.
2000 pN of force produced by simulated fission yeast endocytic actin networks
The majority of bending energy from simulated endocytic actin networks came from capped filaments
Actin polymerization kinetics assay showed that Hip1R-cortactin complex reduced actin assembly based on pyrene fluorescence
Association rate constant of Alexa-488-cofilin to rhodamine-actin filaments was 0.05-0.07 s^-1 uM^-1 for concentrations of cofilin less than 3 uM
Cosedimentation assays showed a binding affinity of 0.9 ± 0.1 µM between Swip1 and actin in the presence of calcium
Knockdown of integrin β3 or α5 in cancer associated fibroblasts (CAF's) reduced fibrillar fibronectin (but not secreted fibronectin) and migration of CT26 cancer cell spheroids.
__in vitro__ branched actin networks decreased in capping rate as a function of  growth stress
Clathrin Light chains gives the clathrin lattice more stronger bending power.
Expressing WT GFP-WASP in __wasA-__ mutants rescues confinement of active Rac to the leading edge of __Dictyostelium__ cells.
In H1299 cells, Knockdown of DNM2 with siRNA decreased the filopodial formation, and filopodia length
hiPSCs at the edge of the colony had larger focal adhesions than cells in the hiPSC colony center
Cells grown on curved quartz substrates coated with fibronectin or vitronectin showed preferential localization of integrin B5 to curved parts of the substrate
Knockdown of DNM2 increases the acetylated microtubule, inducing the increased adenovirus trafficking in primary keratocyte
Pulldown assay with Swiss3T3 lysates showed that GST-bound IRSp53 strongly associated with WAVE, but did not precipitate N-WASP.
Nanocages ranging from 12-120 tagGFP2 molecules expressed in human induced pluripotent stem cells showed a linear relationship between intensity and number of molecules
WASP knockout (__wasA-__) __Dictyostelium__ cells displayed bipolar localization of active Rac, rather than localization to the leading edge.
The immunoelectron microscopy revealed that Cortactin localized on flat or dome shaped-clathrin lattice, and actin filament of COS7 cells
Increased membrane tension due to hypotonic swelling resulted in increased clathrin coat lifetimes and reduction in standard deviation of clathrin growth rates.
Overexpression of a cortactin mutant lacking 3 tyrosine residues reduced CME transferrin uptake by nearly 40%
Knockdown of DNM2 reduced the transferrin internalization in neuronal differentiated CAD cells
Membrane invagination occurred ~6 seconds after scission protein (spHob1-GFP) was detected in budding yeast cells
Nanodissected clathrin lattices in unroofed PTK2 cells relaxed to higher curvature, lower energy configurations
Endogenous Swip1 preferentially bound WT-Rab21 and constitutively active Rab21 over the closely related Rab5 GTPase in MDA-MB-231 cells.
Inhibition of CG pathway in CHO cells by LG186 resulted in no increase in fluid uptake as indicated by fluorescent 10kDa Dextran upon relaxation of membrane tension following stretch.
Overexpression of the CRIB domain of N-WASP inhibited dextran and folate receptor but not transferrin internalization in FRaTb cells
Fluorescent actin label generally localized to STxB-induced membrane tubules in HeLa cells
The folate probe FolateRSense showed fluoresecence patterns in internal spots in OVCAR-3 cells
Deletion of Swip1-EF1 actin-binding region abolished Swip1 ability to facilitate integrin endocytosis.
Hepatic stellate cells grown in a 3D environment showed the same responses to high matrix stiffness as cells grown in 2D culture (TIMP-1 and Caveolin-1 overexpression)
FRaTb-1 cells transfected with dominant negative dnm2-K44A had similar or slightly increased levels of folate receptor antibody internalization
Treatment of SK-MEL2 cells with Jasplakinolide resulted in slower assembly and disassembly rates of dynamin2-GFP at sites of endocytosis
The folate probe FolateRSense showed fluorescence patterns in internal spots and at the periphery of KB cells
Endogenously RFP-tagged clathrin light chain A recovered from photobleaching with a half life of 2 seconds at sites of endocytosis in SKMEL-2 cells
IRSp53-/- MEFs or LG186-treated WT MEFs showed significant reduction in the number of CLICs per field, but no effect on clathrin or caveolae-derived structures.
Steady-state ATPase rate of human myo1e motor and IQ domain pleateaued at 1.2 ± 0.3/s
CLIC/GEEC endosomes internalize GPI-anchored proteins.
GFP-cofilin associated with actin patches between 3 and 4.2 s after initial association of actin/Abp1p -
GFP-tagged ARPC3/Arc18 at C terminus did not affect __in vitro__ actin nucleation rates
In Cav-/- MEFs, a dominant negative Dynamin mutant (DynK44A) showed an extensive tubular network of internalizing cholera toxin binding subunit (CTB), but inhibited trafficking of CTB to the Golgi.
Angle between membrane and clathrin pit increased from 0 to 90 (early phase/U-shaped) and 90 to 180(neck construction & scission) -
GST-WAVE1 in presence of IRSp53 and GST-WAVE2 VCA demonstrate high rates of Arp2/3-mediated actin polymerization in vitro.
The peak number of molecules of twinfilin (Twf1p) per endocytic patch in fission yeast was measured to be 210(+/- 40) by fluorescence microscopy
Fluorescence microscopy and image analysis of fluorescently tagged clathrin, dynamin, and arp2/3 complex in hiPSCs showed ~30% of CME events completing in the absence of detectable actin assembly
Endocytic proteins Clathrin light chain A-RFP and dynamin2-GFP increased in lifetimes as a function of concentration of Arp2/3 complex inhibitor CK666 in SK-MEL-2 cells
The GRAF1 inhibitor LG186 showed significantly reduced fluid phase uptake in WT MEFs that was comparable to the fluid phase uptake in IRSp53-/- MEFS.
Association rate constant of cofilin to actin by presteady state kinetics was 0.008/uM/s
Mouse embryonic fibroblasts (MEFs) from IRSp53-/- mice showed a significantly reduced fluid phase uptake as compared to WT-addback MEFs without affecting transferrin receptor internalization .

Purified Arp2/3 complex activation by GST-WAVE2 and GST-WAVE2 VCA was stimulated in the presence of purified IRSp53 using pyrene-labelled and free monomeric actin in an actin polymerization kinetics study.
Between hPSC colonies plated on glass/polystyrene and on softer VTN-funtionalized hydrogels, no significant change in hPSC colony organizeation and no or modest change in FA number was observed.
The minimum number of yeast cofilin molecules required for severing is 23 +/- 11 molecules.
The persistence length of non-stabilized actin in physiological ionic conditions was found to be $$9 \pm 0.5 \mu m$$
Co-sedimentation assay of purified Swip1/EFhd2 and actin showed actin binds to EFhd2 in vitro.
Mean AP-2 fluorescence lifetime increased for VSV particles compared to DI-T particles and for other pits.
Camostat, a TMPRSS2 inhibitor, had a significantly greater % inhibition for Delta pseudotyped virus (PV) than for Omicron PV when infecting A549 cells overexpressing ACE2 and TMPRSS2.
Both the mean LCa and Clathrin fluorescence lifetime increased for VSV particles compared to pit and DI-T.
Inhibiting polymerization of actin with latB reduced the internalization efficiency of VSV but not DI-T.
AP-2 fluorescence intensity increased after DI-T attachment to the BSC1 cell as the clathrin-coated pit assembled

Electron microscopy showed that with increasing exposure to heat (37C), the number of HCoV-229E viruses localized with or near the orifices (neck) of caveolae increased, where "cross-bridge structures of high electron density were frequently observed between virus particles and the plasma membrane."
The geometries and clathrin coverage of endocytic carries for internalization of DI-T and VSV particles were different when visualized using electron microscopy
DI-T particles did not alter the process of clathrin-coated vesicle formation.
"Binding of HCoV-229E and incubation at 37°C caused clustering of CD13 and its colocalization with caveolin-1."

AP-2 fluorescence in VSV particles is 2x higher and ~2x longer-lived than that of DI-T particles, which are comparable to non-viral endocytic pits; after AP-2 fluorescence peaks at 45s for VSV particles, it drops to 0 a.u. by 60s.
Pre-treatment of cells with the clathrin inhibitor Pitstop or Dynamin inhibitor MiTMAB reduced the number of internalized HCoV-NL63 particles in LLC-Mk2 cells

A strong inhibition of virus internalization in HAE cultures preincubated with clathrin or dynamin inhibitors (Pitstop and MitMAB) compared to DMSO-treated control cells was observed, using confocal microscopy.

DI-T particles internalized in BSC1 cells through canonical, circular clathrin coated pits, while VSV particles internalized into Vero cells in non-canonical, oblong pits as shown by electron microscopy
Compared to the control with DMSO, there was significant inhibition of HCoV-NL63 infection in LLC-Mk2 cells
Electron microscopy showed a complete clathrin coat around DI-T particles, whereas VSV endocytic carriers seemed to be incompletely coated with clathrin.
Treatment with pitstop or MiTMAB reduced the number of infected LLC-Mk2 cells following incubation with the HCoV-NL63 virus.
During coated pit formation of DI-T, there was minimal cortactin recruitment (fluorescence), which peaked before full clathrin assembly
Cortactin intensity spiked at late timepoints during VSV internalization.
Di-T and VSV spots colocalized with AP-2 and LCa over similar periods of time
inhibition of actin polymerization drastically increases the the time of VSV internalization but not DI-T, as seen with increased time of AP-2 fluorescence.
When human fibroblasts were treated with anti-CD13 antibody and anti-caveolin-1 antibody for 60 minutes at 37C, an increase in fluorescence of CD13 and colocalization of caveolin-1 was observed.
LLC-MK2 cells showed no significant differences in replication of HCoV-NL63 under a controlled environment versus a camostat environment
The creation of clathrin-coated pits in BSC1 cells showed minimal cortactin recruitment based on time lapse fluorescence assays
Cortactin intesity spikes during VSV internalization
Depletion of TMPRSS2 afftected the entry of WT and Delta PV to a greater extent than that of the Omicron PV, in a manner dependent on ACE2 expression levels.
E64d, a cathepsin inhibitor, had a significantly greater % inhibition for Omicron pseudotyped virus (PV) than for Delta PV.
VSV and DI-T particles are different lengths
There was a decrease in internalized viral particles when treated with classical clathrin-mediated endocytosis inhibitors Pitstop 2 and MiTMAB.
Using A549-ACE2/TMPRSS2 cells a noticeable, but not statistically significant, difference between live viral forms of omicron and delta, when treated with either TPRSS2 or cathepsin inhibitors
Respondents were not very polarized in function of their party alignment in the US, with fewer than one in five scoring high on the polarization scale.
Heavy Facebook users were more likely to consume information from untrustworthy websites, which was often immediately preceded by a visit to Facebook.
SEM modeling of social media use showed an indirect yet positive effect on polarization for moderate liberals via increased polarization
According to a conditional latent growth curve model (LGM), American adults' online political expression increased support for their candidate.
Strong pro-refugee sentiment amongst Germans was associated with ~2x higher rates of higher education compared to strong anti-refugee sentiment
The majority of Germans fall between extreme positions regarding refugees, with only a small minority expressing extreme pro-refugee or anti-refugee attitudes
Polarized users in likewise polarized neighborhoods distributed their likes across their community pages in a similar way, both in science and conspiracy communities.

The interaction between dual national identity, identifying as both Hong Kongese and Chinese, and political use of social media was negatively associated with attitudinal polarization on position issues.
Self-reporting a dual nationality identity, identifying as both Hong Kongese and Chinese, was negatively associated with attitudinal polarization on valence issues in Hong Kong.
Substantial selective exposure was heavily concentrated among a subset of Americans with conservative information diets.
According to a repeated-measures ANOVA, and latent growth curve modeling (LGM, unconditional model), individuals' candidate preferences grew more stable as Election Day approached.
According to analyses of Facebook data, people's egonets misrepresented how many friends other people have.

Authors on the liberal sites were much more favorable toward left-leaning people and groups than authors on the conservative sites. In addition, those on the left- and right-leaning sites were more extreme than those at the moderate blog on this variable
Fifty-five percent of issue-related conversations involved interactions between users from both sides of union debate.
Extreme users strongly prioritized cognitive congruence in news sharing, in both pro- and anti-Bolsonaro communities. Ideological congruence become less important towards the network center.

For respondents in Hong Kong with a single identity, either only Hong Kongese or only Chinese, model estimates of affective polarization increased from 30° to 40° with frequent social media use, while for those with a dual identity, both Hong Kongese and Chinese, it decreased from 30° to 12° with frequent social media use.

Both Republican and Democrat users reported change in self-reported political ideology towards their own ideological extreme when exposed to opposing views on Twitter, yet only Republicans' effects were statistically significant
Confidence in the president and Congress was positively associated with levels of selective exposure to social media in the US.
AccoA Random Forest algorithm was able to predict the polarization of Twitter users with high accuracy and recall.

Deactivating facebook reduced various measures of political polarization, particularly exposure to news that improve understanding of their own political party (vs. other party), and issue polarization, but not affective polarization.
Enthusiasm among US respondents toward the out-party presidential candidate was positively associated with disagreement expression on social media.
According to SEM modeling, social media use was negatively associated with a shift towards conservatism for  political neutrals, and positively associated with a shift towards liberalism
Facebook users who reported higher differences between feeling-thermometer measures for their own party vs. the other party registered more Facebook use which lead to over-time depolarization
The fragmentation of the audiences of Russian media outlets on the Vkontakte platform occurred mainly along political lines
SEM modeling showed that, for moderate conservatives, there was no direct or indirect effect of social media use for adopting extreme conservatism

Most of the users who retweeted rumor rebuttal tweets displayed the agree attitude. However, the users who commented on rumor rebuttal tweets had more diversified attitudes under various topics, with the majority of individuals holding query or unknown attitudes
Longer lifetime and higher levels of activity of Facebook users corresponded with a lesser number of Facebook pages being consumed.
All of the derogatory words used to talk about Remoaners on Twitter contain negative tribal associations.
27 out of 38 events of the Brexit timelines were associated with unusual spikes in the volume of tribal keywords outside of the normal range.
Smaller Japanese media outlets Twitter accounts had ideologically distinctive followers and were mainly isolated in the network.
More reputable outlets had greater incentives to adjust editorial lines. Less reputable outlets were already sending messages congruent to their preferred user.
Republican users exposed to opposing views on Twitter had an increase in conservatism between 0.11 and 0.59 standard deviations
The majority of Facebook users were active either in the pro-vaccines or anti-vaccines community, not both.
Only at the first wave of data, Facebook users who reported higher differences between feeling-thermometer measures for their own party vs. the other party were more likely to view news on Facebook
Exposure to counter-attitudinal content on Facebook modestly decreased the affective polarization index compared to the pro-attitudinal treatment
Dual identifying Hong Kong residents were 14.8% more likely to have a weak partisan selectivity than single identifiers.
Anger and anxiety among US respondents toward the out-party presidential candidate wass not associated with disagreement expression on social media.
Perceived polarization increased as a function of time spent reading a tweet, but only for Republican users
Deactivating Facebook boosted participants' perception of its role in improving news consumption and increased agreement on the potential impact of deactivating one's account.
deactivating Facebook resulted in improvements on measurements of subjective well-being
Selective exposure and selective avoidance predict polarization, but they are weaker indicators than strength of party ties.
The level of encountered disagreement on social medi predicted the likelihood of expressing disagreement for US respondents, even when accounted for the initial level of expressed disagreement.

The retweeting and commenting user networks of rumor rebuttal under different topics showed highly modular structures; however, the large clusters in retweeting user networks showed high homophily, while the large clusters in commenting user networks had mixed attitudes
According the a polarization index, Italian news sites are strongly polarizated on the issue of the Italian constitutional referendum.

Pro-attitudinal news uses were not found to mediate the relationship between Facebook use at wave 1 and higher differences between feeling-thermometer measures for users' own party vs. the other party at wave 3

According to regression analysis, heterogeneous conversations were longer when they involved users who are placed on the more moderate and central positions of the debate, and were probably more disposed to hear the other side.

The variance of response about EU issues between those who got most of the news from social networks or other types of media was very small for participants who had positive predispositions toward the EU.
Regression analyses of American adults showed that the relationship between political party and political opinions increased as people expressed themselves politically.
Germans across the ideological spectrum perceived the media to have biases favoring their opposing ideological group on the topic of refugees
According to regression analysis, heterogeneity increased the level of depth of conversations.
SEM modeling showed that, among neutrals, social media use was positively associated with political engagement, which was also positively associated with political polarization toward liberalism.
According to a survey, educated Ethiopians believed that social media helps and hurts democracy in Ethiopia.
Facebook news use at wave 1 resulted in depolarization at wave 3 via exposure to counter-attitudinal news
According to regression analyses, individuals on WhatsApp and Twitter became more embedded in homophilic interaction networks than Facebook users.
Deactivating Facebook resulted in significant declines in both self-reported news attention and objectively measured news knowledge.
Engaging in polarizing content increased the probability to have friends with similar characteristics.
The out-party feed increased affective polarization compared to the control group, but the difference was not statistically significant
The in-party feed slightly decreased affective polarization compared to the control group, but this difference was not statistically significant
Most Japanese media accounts were followed on Twitter by both liberal and conservative users, and the followers of major media accounts overlapped to a significant extent.
Republicans were more likely than Democrats to share extreme *pro*-Republican news sources and less likely to share extreme *pro*-Democratic news sources, and vice versa.
The effect of being offered subscriptions to news outlets from the opposite ideological position on a political opinions index was small and not statistically significant.
SEM modeling showed that social media use by liberals was positively associated with political engagement, and in turn, was positively associated with political polarization toward strong liberalism

Estimating the conditional effects of the data for American adults showed that party identification predicted political opinions at any value of political expression, but the relationship was stronger when political expression was high.
The cognitive reflection test was weakly associated with sharing real news sources.

The majority (80-90%)of networks of tweets about the Italian referendum shared links had the same model-estimated stance towards the referendum as the users who shared them. Retweet and quote networks had almost 100% of within-stance.
Derogatory Brextremist discourse on Twitter included many terms that suggested lack of sanity (e.g., nutters, loonies) and references to fear and hatred of foreigners and destruction of Britain.

The variance of response about EU issues between those who got most of the news from social networks or other types of media was very small for participants who had negative  predispositions toward the EU.
Party identification predicts political opinions at any value of political expression but the relationship is stronger when political expression is high.

US respondents who self-reported selectively using social networking sites with political content that aligned with their own views were more likely to have a stronger difference in favorability ratings between Republican vs. Democratic parties.
According to regression analysis, social network heterogeneity positively influenced ethnic, ideological, and party polarization.
As shown by comparing percentages between Facebook, Twitter, and WhatsApp users, homophily was higher on Twitter and WhatsApp than Facebook.
US survey respondents self-reported greater ideological distance between Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton after seeing negative campaign tweets from either candidate, compared to seeing no tweets
Users polarized towards a narrative tended to consume nearly exclusively content adhering to their system of beliefs.
Multiple mediation analyses showed that posting news in WhatsApp groups was associated with exposure to diverse perspectives.
There were no striking divisions between users exposing different stances in the reply-to Twitter network of the Italian referendum.
According to Poisson regression, women were underrepresented among top Instagram degrees, indicative of a glass ceiling effect (p.3).
